itemDescription: New Zealand and British chess player

wikipedia_page.main: Robert Graham Wade  (10 April 1921, Dunedin, New Zealand – 29 November 2008, London, England), was a New Zealand and English chess player, writer, arbiter, coach, and promoter. He was New Zealand champion three times, British champion twice, and played in seven Chess Olympiads and one Interzonal tournament. Wade held the titles of International Master and International Arbiter.
